description.narrative: To improve core urban functions in an equitable and resource efficient manner by removing identified infrastructure bottlenecks hampering land development, transport, and environmental conditions in four second-tier cities in Sichuan Province.

provider-org.narrative: International Bank for Reconstruction and Development

condition.narrative: From 2007, Mianyang and Suining each to submit a annual plan and annual report on long-term investments for constructioninvestments amd public services in the three Economic Development Zones
From 2008, Four project cities each to submit to the Bank a plan for operation and maintenance (including budget) ofinfrastructureconstructed under the Project
Implementation of EMP, RAP and the cost of implementation, cost of public investments, process of auction, price negotiation andallocation of land are to be monoitored and reported to the Bank
In development of the 3 economic development zones, Mianyang and Suining will sell/transfer land through auction, negotiated priceand allocation in accordance with domestic laws and regulations
MIANYANG AND SUINING EACH TO FURNISH A LONG TERM INVESTMENT PLAN FOR 2007-2013 (INCLUDING BUDGET) FOR CONSTRUCTION INVESTMENTS AND
Mianyang will complete the award of contract for constructing the municipal section of Second Ring Road (2RR) before the award ofcontract for constructing the project section of 2RR.
Mianyang will furnish to the Bank an EA, EMP, and RAP for the municipal section of 2RR.
PWAC to produce total revenues equivalent to not less than 1.3 times the sum of operating expenses and the amount by which deptservice requirements exceed the provision for depriciations (after CY09)
PWAC will produce total revenues equivalent to not less than the sum of its total operating expenses and the amount by which debtservice requirements exceed the provision for depreciations after CY07
Panzhihua and Panzhihua Water Affair Company (PWAC) complete the contract for constructing the Qingxiangping WWTP before the awardof contract for constructing the wastewater collection systems
Sichuan to prepare and submit to the Bank a mid-term report
Sichuan with the Bank to review the mid-term report
Various responsible agencies and project companies will implement the EA, EMP and RAP when they carry out the project activitiesorlinked activities

comment.narrative: This include all roads and sewage and drainage pipelines (including service roads as described in the restructuring paper).
Cumulative for all 4 cities.
Core indicators being measured first time at an aggregate level for all cities.

title.narrative: Mianyang: Number of new residents on site

comment.narrative: The numbers reflect changes in policies after the Earthquake, with more residents moving to PP.
Difficult to quantify in how far this (infrastructure) project contributes to land sales and values.
The previous number in the report for SEDZ was wrong and has been corrected.

title.narrative: Suining: Number of new residents on site

comment.narrative: Difficult to quantify in how far this (infrastructure) project contributes to this indicator (land area sold).

title.narrative: Yibin: Reduced travel time from Mianjiang Bridge to Chang Jiang Bridge: Travel time in minutes at peak
Suining: Travel time in minutes at peak from Railway station to Xining District

comment.narrative: No data has been reported recently.

title.narrative: Panzhihua: Wastewater service coverage (average wastewater volume collected and treated, 1000 m3/d)

comment.narrative: Revised since the previous number was wrong (referred to length of sewer constructed).

title.narrative: Panzhihua: Reduced travel time at peak in minutes -- East Duren Road at KM 49 to railway station

comment.narrative: Greatly reduced as a result of a tunnel built.

title.narrative: Yibin: Satisfaction of PAPs with resettlement process and outcome

target.value: 75% of PAPs satisfied with resettlement process and outcome

comment.narrative: A proper survey needs to be conducted.

title.narrative: Yibin: Satisfaction level of landscape improvements

target.value: 75% of sampled people satisfied with landscape improvements

comment.narrative: A proper survey needs to be conducted.

title.narrative: Panzhihua: Satisfaction of PAPs with resettlement process and outcome

target.value: 75% of PAPs satisfied with resettlement process and outcome

comment.narrative: A survey will be conducted at the end of project when resettlement activities have been fully completed.

title.narrative: Mianyang: Satisfaction of PAPs with resettlement process and outcome in both Pioneer Park and SEDZ.

target.value: 75% of PAPs satisfied with resettlement process and outcome both in Pioneer Park and SEDZ

comment.narrative: Final survey is being prepared as the reported number of 100% is not believable and need to be substantiated.

title.narrative: Panzhihua: Satisfaction level of scenic improvements

target.value: 75% of sampled people satisfied with landscape improvements

comment.narrative: Results will be provided as part of the final survey.

title.narrative: Suining: Satisfaction of PAPs with resettlement process and outcome

target.value: 75% of PAPs satisfied with resettlement process and outcome

comment.narrative: Site visits find the majority of PAP satisfied, but more detailed information needs to be collected after completion of activities.

title.narrative: Evidence that identified bottlenecks have been removed, as expected by the strategic investments of the project, including a high level of satisfaction among users of investments and PAP

target.value: Evidence identified via reports from technical and social audits

actual.value: Time savings on the roads are apparent adn overal satisfaction of PAPs is high, but need a more detailed assessment.

comment.narrative: Critical bottlenecks have been addressed and roads are operational.

title.narrative: People provided with access to “improved sanitation facilities” - urban

comment.narrative: Based on number of households connected (8,125) x 3 people/household.
Based on number of households connected (7,100) x 3 people/household.

title.narrative: People provided with access to ‘improved sanitation facilities” under the proj.

comment.narrative: Based on number of households connected (7,100) x 3 people/household.
